title: Cold War: The Battle of Narratives
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Cold War: The Battle of Narratives.

hook.text: The Cold War was fought with words as much as weapons. Both superpowers waged war through stories.

discovery.text: The CIA secretly funded literary magazines, art exhibitions, and jazz tours to promote American culture worldwide.

twist.text: Both sides claimed to represent freedom while suppressing dissent at home â€” rhetoric and reality diverged sharply.

climax.text: The Cold War showed that controlling the narrative can be as powerful as controlling territory.

punchline.text: The biggest war of the 20th century was fought with stories.

quiz.question: How did the CIA wage cultural propaganda during the Cold War?
options: By secretly funding magazines, art, and jazz tours
